etymologies: late Middle English: from ecclesiastical Latin crucifixio(n-), from the verb crucifigere (see crucify)

definitions: the execution of a person by nailing or binding them to a cross

examples.text: there is little evidence that the Romans used to flog their victims before crucifixion

shortDefinitions: ancient form of execution in which person was nailed or bound to cross

definitions: the killing of Jesus Christ by crucifixion

examples.text: Paul appears on the scene within a year or so of the Crucifixion

shortDefinitions: killing of Jesus Christ by crucifixion

definitions: an artistic representation or musical composition based on the Crucifixion
shortDefinitions: artistic representation or musical composition based on Crucifixion
